original: @506a / /rgya nag gi 'gyur shloo ka bdun brgya rtsa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: @506a / /rgya nag gi 'gyur shloo ka bdun brgya rtsa bcu gnyis te /
translated: The Chinese translation has 712 ślokas.

original: bam po gnyis dang / sho lo ka brgya bcu gnyis //
analyzed: bam po gnyis dang / sho lo ka brgya bcu gnyis //
translated: Two fascicles, 112 ślokas.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'phags pa rtogs pa chen po yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa rtogs pa chen po yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo /
translated: Noble Sūtra of the Great Realization in Full

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Fascicle One

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i cho ga dang / mtshan nas brjod pa'i yon tan gyi gleng gzhi dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan dang / mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nas brjod cing phyag 'tshal ba dang /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i cho ga dang / mtshan nas brjod pa'i yon tan gyi gleng gzhi dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan dang / mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nas brjod cing phyag 'tshal ba dang /
translated: The chapter on the ritual of paying homage, the nidāna of the qualities of reciting the names, the names of the tathāgatas of the three times, the twelve sūtras, and the recitation of the names and homage to the bodhisattvas,

original: bshags pa'i le'u rnams 'byung ba nyi tshe bcos shing bsgyur ba /
analyzed: bshags pa'i le'u rnams 'byung ba nyi tshe bcos shing bsgyur ba /
translated: and the chapter on confession, are partially edited and translated.

original: de nas phyogs bcu nas lhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lhan cig tu thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas phyogs bcu nas lhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lhan cig tu thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then, the bodhisattvas from the ten directions all joined their palms together and requested the Blessed One:

original: @506b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @506b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: bdag cag rnams phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas de dag gi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir mchis te bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal mthong la /
analyzed: bdag cag rnams phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas de dag gi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir mchis te bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal mthong la /
translated: “By the power and blessings of those buddhas of the ten directions, we have come to this world and seen the face of the Blessed One.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos thos nas bdag cag dang / lha dang mis mdo sde gsung rab 'di lan gcig 'dzin pa dang / 'chang bar gsol te gnang bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos thos nas bdag cag dang / lha dang mis mdo sde gsung rab 'di lan gcig 'dzin pa dang / 'chang bar gsol te gnang bar 'tshal na /
translated: Having heard the Mahāyāna Dharma, we request and beseech you to allow us and the gods and humans to uphold and preserve this sūtra of the Buddha’s teachings.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i slad na yul khams 'di dang / phyogs gzhan du ri dang / tshal dang / shing drung gi rig sngas 'chang ba'i gnas dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang gnas dang / khyim dang / dgon pa'i gnas dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i slad na yul khams 'di dang / phyogs gzhan du ri dang / tshal dang / shing drung gi rig sngas 'chang ba'i gnas dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang gnas dang / khyim dang / dgon pa'i gnas dang /
translated: After the Blessed One has passed into parinirvāṇa, in this country and in other places, in the abodes of those who uphold the knowledge mantras of mountains, forests, and the foot of trees, in villages, cities, dwellings, houses, and hermitages,

original: dur khrod dang / shing drung dang / bla gab med pa dang / mchod rten dang / gtsug lag khang dang / dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba dang / mi mang po 'du ba'i chos bshad pa'i gnas dang / mi phal gyi gnas dang /
analyzed: dur khrod dang / shing drung dang / bla gab med pa dang / mchod rten dang / gtsug lag khang dang / dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba dang / mi mang po 'du ba'i chos bshad pa'i gnas dang / mi phal gyi gnas dang /
translated: under trees, in the open, in stūpas, in temples, in the parks of the saṃgha, in places where the Dharma is taught and where many people gather, in the homes of ordinary people,

original: mir gyur pa thams cad la rgya cher khyab par bstan te rgyun mi 'chad par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mir gyur pa thams cad la rgya cher khyab par bstan te rgyun mi 'chad par bgyi'o //
translated: and in the homes of all human beings.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas na ngan 'gro rnams gtan du bkag pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas na ngan 'gro rnams gtan du bkag pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because if the sublime Dharma endures for a long time, the lower realms will be closed forever.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan bas sems can dmyal ba'i sgo bkum zhes thos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan bas sems can dmyal ba'i sgo bkum zhes thos te /
translated: We have heard that the teachings of the Blessed One have closed the doors to the hells.

original: chos kyi gzhung 'di las tshig 'bru gcig tsam kha ton du bton na /
analyzed: chos kyi gzhung 'di las tshig 'bru gcig tsam kha ton du bton na /
translated: If even a single word from this Dharma treatise is recited,

original: lha rnams kyang dga' zhing mgu ste rtag tu bsnyen zhing mchis nas rang yang dge ba spyod par bgyid lags so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyang dga' zhing mgu ste rtag tu bsnyen zhing mchis nas rang yang dge ba spyod par bgyid lags so //
translated: the gods will be delighted and satisfied. They will always attend and be present, and they themselves will engage in virtuous conduct.

original: mi la la dag kyang rtogs pa chen @507a *//
analyzed: mi la la dag kyang rtogs pa chen @507a *//
translated: Some human beings will also attain great realization.

original: pos yongs su rgyas pa'i chos kyi gzhung 'di thos nas dga' zhing mgu la mos shing gus te yi ger 'bri la 'don cing klog pa dang / 'dzin cing 'chang la phyag 'tshal te chos kyi gzhung 'di las bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga'i mtshan dang /
analyzed: pos yongs su rgyas pa'i chos kyi gzhung 'di thos nas dga' zhing mgu la mos shing gus te yi ger 'bri la 'don cing klog pa dang / 'dzin cing 'chang la phyag 'tshal te chos kyi gzhung 'di las bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga'i mtshan dang /
translated: If someone hears this Dharma discourse that is completely filled with merit, and after hearing it, they are delighted, pleased, and respectful, and write it out, recite it, read it, uphold it, and venerate it, and if they recite the names of any of the thus-gone ones and bodhisattvas taught in this Dharma discourse,

original: byang chub sems dpal 'ga'i ming nas brjod na'ang mi des da ltar gyi tshe 'di la bde zhing skyid pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba mi 'byung la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpal 'ga'i ming nas brjod na'ang mi des da ltar gyi tshe 'di la bde zhing skyid pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba mi 'byung la /
translated: that person will be happy and joyful in this present life, and no negative or unwholesome actions will occur.

original: nam 'gum pa'i tshe na'ang bdag cag byang chub sems dpa' dang / lta rnams kyis de'i mdon du shul 'dren cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dag mthong la /
analyzed: nam 'gum pa'i tshe na'ang bdag cag byang chub sems dpa' dang / lta rnams kyis de'i mdon du shul 'dren cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dag mthong la /
translated: When they die, we bodhisattvas and gods will lead them to the pure buddha realms.

original: dad nas gnas gcig tu skye bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: dad nas gnas gcig tu skye bar 'gyur ro /
translated: They will see those realms and, with faith, will be reborn in one of them.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi gzhung 'di len cing yongs su bzung ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gzhung 'di len cing yongs su bzung ba'i slad du'o //
translated: It is because they have received and upheld this Dharma discourse.”

original: mdo sde 'di len cing yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di len cing yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
translated: To receive and uphold this sutra

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su 'dzin pa lags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su 'dzin pa lags so //
translated: is to uphold the Buddha’s body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa de ni /
translated: To uphold the Tathāgata’s body

original: byang chub sems dpa' lags te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lags te /
translated: is to be a bodhisattva.

original: de bas na; bdag cag dang bslab pa gcig ste /
analyzed: de bas na; bdag cag dang bslab pa gcig ste /
translated: Therefore, we are of the same training.

original: rgyu de'i slad du chos kyi gzhung 'di yongs su bzung bas gnas gcig tu skye zhing gcig gis gcig mi spong zhing mi 'bral bas smon lam gcig pa lags so //
analyzed: rgyu de'i slad du chos kyi gzhung 'di yongs su bzung bas gnas gcig tu skye zhing gcig gis gcig mi spong zhing mi 'bral bas smon lam gcig pa lags so //
translated: For this reason, by upholding this Dharma discourse, we will be born in the same place, not abandoning or separating from each other, and will have the same aspirations.”

original: de nas yang lha ma srin rnams kyi rgyal po dang / tshangs pa chen po'i rgyal po dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / 'jig rten skyong ba phyogs bzhi'i @507b rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / phyag brnyan lag na rdo rje dag dang /
analyzed: de nas yang lha ma srin rnams kyi rgyal po dang / tshangs pa chen po'i rgyal po dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / 'jig rten skyong ba phyogs bzhi'i @507b rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / phyag brnyan lag na rdo rje dag dang /
translated: Then the kings of the rākṣasas, the king of the Mahābrahmās, the gods of the Trāyastriṃśa heaven, the four great kings who are guardians of the world, and the attendants Vajrapāṇi

original: sde dpon chen po la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo dang / lha ma yin gyi rgyal po dang / nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po dang / mi 'am ci'i rgyal po dang / bu dgu ma'i lha dang /
analyzed: sde dpon chen po la sogs pa dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo dang / lha ma yin gyi rgyal po dang / nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po dang / mi 'am ci'i rgyal po dang / bu dgu ma'i lha dang /
translated: the great leaders and so forth, the nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, the asura kings, the garuḍa kings, the kinnara kings, the gods of the nine sons,

original: ri'i lha dang / shing gi lha dang / 'bab chu'i lha dang / mtsho'i lha dang / sa'i lha dang / chu'i lha dang / me'i lha dang / rlung gi lha la sogs pa'i rgyal po dang / de dag la sogs pa tshad med grangs med pa dag dang /
analyzed: ri'i lha dang / shing gi lha dang / 'bab chu'i lha dang / mtsho'i lha dang / sa'i lha dang / chu'i lha dang / me'i lha dang / rlung gi lha la sogs pa'i rgyal po dang / de dag la sogs pa tshad med grangs med pa dag dang /
translated: the mountain gods, the tree gods, the waterfall gods, the lake gods, the earth gods, the water gods, the fire gods, the wind gods, and so forth, the kings, and so forth, immeasurable and countless,

original: lha chen po rnams dang 'khod pa las langs te gdong dang spyi bos phyag btsal nas thal mo sbyar te rjes dang gus par bcas pas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: lha chen po rnams dang 'khod pa las langs te gdong dang spyi bos phyag btsal nas thal mo sbyar te rjes dang gus par bcas pas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: arose from their seats in the assembly with the great gods and, bowing their heads and foreheads, with palms joined in respect and devotion, they requested the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag la sogs pas slan chad rtag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rtogs pa chen pos yongs su rgyas pa'i chos kyi gzhung 'di yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pas slan chad rtag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rtogs pa chen pos yongs su rgyas pa'i chos kyi gzhung 'di yongs su bzung ste /
translated: We and others will henceforth always uphold this Dharma treatise, which is fully developed by the great realization taught by the Blessed One.

original: mdo sde 'di gang na gnas par bdag cag lha'i rgyal po rnams rtag tu de'i mdun du mchis te gtsang zhing dag par bgyis la /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gang na gnas par bdag cag lha'i rgyal po rnams rtag tu de'i mdun du mchis te gtsang zhing dag par bgyis la /
translated: Wherever this sūtra resides, we, the kings of the gods, will always be in front of it, making it clean and pure.

original: mchod rten gyi nad ngam /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi nad ngam /
translated: Whether in a temple,

original: mi phal gyi gnas sam /
analyzed: mi phal gyi gnas sam /
translated: in the dwelling of an ordinary person,

original: dben pa'i phyogs na gnas sam /
analyzed: dben pa'i phyogs na gnas sam /
translated: in a solitary place,

original: yang na mdo sde 'di la gtsang sbra ma phyed pa'i yan lag gis 'dzin kyang rung /
analyzed: yang na mdo sde 'di la gtsang sbra ma phyed pa'i yan lag gis 'dzin kyang rung /
translated: or even if this sūtra is held with a branch of impurity,

original: bdag cag gis mi de la mi rigs pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis mi de la mi rigs pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs par bgyi'o //
translated: we will ensure that that person is not harmed by any misfortune.

original: de mchis pa'i gnas khyim gyi rim gro'ang bgyi'o //
analyzed: de mchis pa'i gnas khyim gyi rim gro'ang bgyi'o //
translated: We will also provide for the needs of their homes.

original: bdag cag lha'i rgyal po la sogs pa thams cad kyis de phan tshun mchi na'ang de'i mdun du 'dren cing @508a *//
analyzed: bdag cag lha'i rgyal po la sogs pa thams cad kyis de phan tshun mchi na'ang de'i mdun du 'dren cing @508a *//
translated: We, the kings of the gods and all others, will lead them wherever they go.

original: shul sel ba dang / ci 'tshal ba bsgrub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shul sel ba dang / ci 'tshal ba bsgrub par bgyi'o //
translated: I will remove any obstacles and accomplish whatever is needed.

original: de phyogs bzhi dag tu mchis na'ang sgrib cing chags pa ma mchis la /
analyzed: de phyogs bzhi dag tu mchis na'ang sgrib cing chags pa ma mchis la /
translated: Even if they go to the four directions, they will not be obstructed or hindered.

original: rtag tu dga' ba'i chos mthong zhing tshe brjes na lha'i nang du skye ba dang / de'i bsod nams kyis sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mjal zhing theg pa chen po las mi nyams par bgyid do //
analyzed: rtag tu dga' ba'i chos mthong zhing tshe brjes na lha'i nang du skye ba dang / de'i bsod nams kyis sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mjal zhing theg pa chen po las mi nyams par bgyid do //
translated: They will always see the joyful Dharma, and when they change lives, they will be reborn among the gods. By their merit, they will meet the appearance of the Buddha and will not fall away from the Mahāyāna.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha ma srin rnams kyi rgyal po la sogs pa dag la bka' stsal pa /🔽de de bzhin te //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha ma srin rnams kyi rgyal po la sogs pa dag la bka' stsal pa / de de bzhin te //
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, the kings of the devas and rākṣasas, and so on:

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “It is so, it is so!

original: khyod kyis smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos kyi gzhung 'di lta bu 'di thos par yang dka' na rtogs par lta smos kyi dgos /
analyzed: chos kyi gzhung 'di lta bu 'di thos par yang dka' na rtogs par lta smos kyi dgos /
translated: It is difficult to hear this kind of Dharma treatise, let alone understand it.

original: chos kyi gzhung 'di len cing 'dzin la /
analyzed: chos kyi gzhung 'di len cing 'dzin la /
translated: If one receives and holds this Dharma treatise,

original: 'don cing klog par byed na /
analyzed: 'don cing klog par byed na /
translated: recites it, and reads it,

original: gtsang sbra dang / khrus kyis dag cing dad par byas la gos gtsang ma bgos te /
analyzed: gtsang sbra dang / khrus kyis dag cing dad par byas la gos gtsang ma bgos te /
translated: Having purified and made pure through ablutions and having put on clean clothes,

original: gnas gtsang mar byas la dar gyi bla bre dang / ba dan la sogs pas gnas kyi nang bzang bar byas te brgyan la /
analyzed: gnas gtsang mar byas la dar gyi bla bre dang / ba dan la sogs pas gnas kyi nang bzang bar byas te brgyan la /
translated: in a clean place, having made the interior of the house good with silk canopies, banners, and so forth, having adorned it,

original: spos mchog tu dri zhim pa tsandan dang / phye ma dag gi byug pa dang / spos rnam pa mang po bsregs nas phyag 'tshal te nyin zhag gcig la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du de lta bur nyin zhag bdun gyi bar du chos kyi gzhung 'di klog cing 'don te sems dang yid mi g-yeng ba dang /
analyzed: spos mchog tu dri zhim pa tsandan dang / phye ma dag gi byug pa dang / spos rnam pa mang po bsregs nas phyag 'tshal te nyin zhag gcig la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du de lta bur nyin zhag bdun gyi bar du chos kyi gzhung 'di klog cing 'don te sems dang yid mi g-yeng ba dang /
translated: having anointed it with the best of perfumes, with sandalwood and powders, having burned many kinds of incense, having prostrated, having read and recited this treatise of Dharma in that way three times a day and three times a night for seven days, with undistracted mind and thought,

original: dran pa mi g-yel zhing gcig tu brtan pa dang / bsam pa drang ba dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag cing 'gro ba dang len cing 'dzin @508b pa ma 'khrul ba dang / spyod lam brtan pa dang / 'don cing zlos pa phyin ci ma log pa de lta bu'i tshul du mdo sde 'di las bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: dran pa mi g-yel zhing gcig tu brtan pa dang / bsam pa drang ba dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag cing 'gro ba dang len cing 'dzin @508b pa ma 'khrul ba dang / spyod lam brtan pa dang / 'don cing zlos pa phyin ci ma log pa de lta bu'i tshul du mdo sde 'di las bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang /
translated: They should be undistracted and single-pointedly focused, have an upright mind, be mindful and undeluded in their movements, acceptances, and retentions, have a stable demeanor, and recite without error.

original: mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nas brjod cing bklags la mos shing gus pas de ltar phyag 'tshal zhing 'chad ba ni /
analyzed: mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nas brjod cing bklags la mos shing gus pas de ltar phyag 'tshal zhing 'chad ba ni /
translated: In this way, they should recite and read the names of the thus-gone ones, the twelve branches of scripture, and the bodhisattvas, and pay homage to them with devotion and respect.

original: mdo sde 'di las bshad pa bzhin du sdig lce ba thams cad yang dag par bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las bshad pa bzhin du sdig lce ba thams cad yang dag par bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all their misdeeds will be completely purified, just as explained in this discourse.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rtogs pa chen pos yongs su rgyas pa'i chos kyi gzhung 'di ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa chen pos yongs su rgyas pa'i chos kyi gzhung 'di ni /
translated: This Dharma treatise, which is replete with great realizations,

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang spyad cing sbyangs la byin gyis brlabs nas yongs su bzung ba ste /🔽sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang spyad cing sbyangs la byin gyis brlabs nas yongs su bzung ba ste / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni /
translated: It is the practice and purification and the blessing and the complete acceptance of all the buddhas of the ten directions.🔽It is the practice of all the buddhas.🔽

original: yum mo // mdo sde rnams kyi ni /
analyzed: yum mo // mdo sde rnams kyi ni /
translated: It is the mother of all the buddhas of the ten directions,

original: rgyal po'o // mchog gi gzhung gi ni /
analyzed: rgyal po'o // mchog gi gzhung gi ni /
translated: the king of all the sūtras,🔽the treasury of the supreme texts,

original: mdzod do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni /
analyzed: mdzod do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni /
translated: the path of all bodhisattvas,

original: lam mo; ;rtogs pa chen pos yongs su rgyas pa 'di mchog tu zab pa'i chos kyi gzhung gi snying po'o //🔽gcig tu dper na /
analyzed: lam mo; ;rtogs pa chen pos yongs su rgyas pa 'di mchog tu zab pa'i chos kyi gzhung gi snying po'o // gcig tu dper na /
translated: and the essence of the most profound Dharma texts that are filled with great realization.

original: 'jig rten na chen po bzhi la sogs pa rnam pa drug dang mtshungs shing bsam gyis mi khyab ste /🔽drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na chen po bzhi la sogs pa rnam pa drug dang mtshungs shing bsam gyis mi khyab ste / drug gang zhe na /
translated: It is like a great earth,🔽a great water,🔽a great fire,

original: sa chen po dang / chu chen po dang / ma chen po dang / rlung chen po ste /
analyzed: sa chen po dang / chu chen po dang / ma chen po dang / rlung chen po ste /
translated: a great wind,🔽a great sun,

original: chen po bzhi dang / nyi ma dang / stong pa ste /🔽drug go / de la mdo sde 'di ni /
analyzed: chen po bzhi dang / nyi ma dang / stong pa ste /🔽drug go / de la mdo sde 'di ni /

analyzed: dper na / sa chen po dang 'dra bar gtsang sme dang / bzang ngan che chung thams cad theg pa yin no // yang mdo sde 'di ni /
translated: It is like the great earth, for it is the vehicle of all that is pure and impure, good and bad, great and small.

analyzed: dper na / me chen po dang 'dra bar las dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma mi gtsang ba'i sbar sbur thams cad sreg pa yin no // yang mdo sde 'di ni / dper na / rlung chen po dang 'dra bar las dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma mi gtsang ba'i phyag dar thams cad 'thor zhing 'bud pa yin no //
translated: This sutra is like a great fire, for it burns all the filth and impurities of the defilements of karma and afflictions.

original: yang mdo sde 'di ni; dper na /
analyzed: yang mdo sde 'di ni; dper na /
translated: This sutra is like a great wind, for it blows away and disperses all the filth and impurities of the defilements of karma and afflictions.

original: nyi ma dang 'dra bar ma rig pa'i mun nag thams cad kun tu snang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma dang 'dra bar ma rig pa'i mun nag thams cad kun tu snang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This sutra is like the sun, for it illuminates all the darkness of ignorance.

original: yang mdo sde 'di ni /
analyzed: yang mdo sde 'di ni /
translated: This sutra is like the moon, for it cools the burning afflictions.

original: dper na / nam mkha' stong pa dang 'dra bar dngos po ma lus pa thams cad go 'byed cing shong bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' stong pa dang 'dra bar dngos po ma lus pa thams cad go 'byed cing shong bar byed do //
translated: For example, just as empty space accommodates and contains all things without exception,

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rtogs pa chen pos yongs su rgyas pa'i mdo 'di rgya che ba ni /
translated: this sutra of the Mahayana, which is fully developed by great realization, is vast

original: zla med pa yin te /
analyzed: zla med pa yin te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' man chad nyan thos dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa la thug pa thams cad shong bar byed do //
translated: It accommodates all from the bodhisattvas down to the śrāvakas, and from the desire realm up to the formless realm.

original: de bas na khyed kyis mdo sde 'di longs la yongs su bzung ba dang / rgya cher spel zhing khyab par gyis shig /
analyzed: de bas na khyed kyis mdo sde 'di longs la yongs su bzung ba dang / rgya cher spel zhing khyab par gyis shig /

original: mdo sde 'di la mos shing gus par gyis te /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la mos shing gus par gyis te /

original: khyed la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis rtag par sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud la /
analyzed: khyed la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis rtag par sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud la /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong bar gyis shig /
translated: and see the intrinsic nature of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: khyed lha'i rgyal po dag mdos de 'di len cing yongs su 'dzin pa rnams kyis rtag tu ba dang ma byon pa'i @509b sangs rgyas thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ste chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba mthong bar gyis shig /
translated: You, the kings of the gods, who accept and uphold this dhāraṇī, will always see all the buddhas of the past, present, and future attain perfect enlightenment and turn the great wheel of the Dharma.”

original: de nas 'khor mang po 'dus pa'i nang nas byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i mtshan zhes bya ba stan las langs te gos legs par bgos nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas 'khor mang po 'dus pa'i nang nas byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i mtshan zhes bya ba stan las langs te gos legs par bgos nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, from within the assembly, the bodhisattva named Āśayabala rose from his seat, adjusted his upper robe on one shoulder, bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One, and said to the Blessed One,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; bdag cag la sogs pas skye bo mang po la sman pa dang bde ba'i slad du gsol zhing zhu na gnang ba'i skabs dbye bar gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, if we request it for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to many beings, please grant us the opportunity to ask questions.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i mtshan la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i mtshan la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Āśayabala,

original: mos pa'i mtshan /
analyzed: mos pa'i mtshan /
translated: “Āśayabala,

analyzed: khyod kyis skye bo mang po la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhu ba zhus pa legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent! You have asked this for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to many people.

analyzed: khyod kyis ci dang ci zhus pa nyon cig dang ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: khyod kyis zhus pa'ang dpag tu med pa'i skye bo la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: What you have asked about is for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to an immeasurable number of people.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i mtshan gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i mtshan gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Adhimukticinta said to the Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: bdag dran pa sngon 'das pa'i dus na bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan rin chen gtsug tor can zhes bgyi ba de'i mtshan lan gcig thos pa tsam gyis kyang lhar skye ba thob bo //
analyzed: bdag dran pa sngon 'das pa'i dus na bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan rin chen gtsug tor can zhes bgyi ba de'i mtshan lan gcig thos pa tsam gyis kyang lhar skye ba thob bo //
translated: I remember that in the past, merely by hearing the name of the Bhagavān named Ratnaśikhin once, I attained birth as a god.

original: slad kyis yun mi ring ba zhig na rgyal po lha'i dbang phyug 'od ces bgyi ba'i yul khams dgon pa'i nang zhig la lu ma chen po zhig mchis pa'i chab bskams @510a *//
analyzed: slad kyis yun mi ring ba zhig na rgyal po lha'i dbang phyug 'od ces bgyi ba'i yul khams dgon pa'i nang zhig la lu ma chen po zhig mchis pa'i chab bskams @510a *//

analyzed: te de'i nang na chab nya stong phrag bcu zhig gdugs kyis gdungs nas 'gum du nye ba zhig mchis pa la /

original: tshong dpon gyi bu chu 'bebs zhes bgyi ba zhig gis chab nya de dag mthong ba dang / snying rje ba'i sems skyes te chab dang zas kyi sbyin pa stsal nas dgung mang po mi thub cing 'tsho ba yun mi ring bar 'tshal te /
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu chu 'bebs zhes bgyi ba zhig gis chab nya de dag mthong ba dang / snying rje ba'i sems skyes te chab dang zas kyi sbyin pa stsal nas dgung mang po mi thub cing 'tsho ba yun mi ring bar 'tshal te /
translated: A merchant’s son called Vimalatejā saw the fish and, moved by compassion, gave them water and food. He knew that they would not live for many days and that their lives would not last long.

original: de nas tshong dpon gyi bu chu 'bebs kyis bcom ldan 'das rin chen gtsug tor can gyi mtshan lan gsum brjod pas nya de rnams kyis thos pas tshe 'phos ma thag tu sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lhar skyes so //
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon gyi bu chu 'bebs kyis bcom ldan 'das rin chen gtsug tor can gyi mtshan lan gsum brjod pas nya de rnams kyis thos pas tshe 'phos ma thag tu sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lhar skyes so //
translated: Then the merchant’s son Vimalatejā recited the name of the Blessed Ratnashikhin three times. The fish heard it and as soon as they died they were reborn as gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Therefore, Blessed One,

original: 'khor 'di dag dang / ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la sman pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan bstan cing bsgrag par gsol; bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i mtshan kyang thos na /🔽dpag tu mchis shing /

analyzed: brjod du ma mchis pa'i skye bo mang po la sman pa dang / bde ba thob cing rtag tu longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / dpag tu ma mchis pa'i bsod nams kyi gter rnyed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid kyang mngon sum du rtogs par 'gyur ba'i slad du gsol pa dang /
translated: it will bring benefit and happiness to countless beings, enabling them to always enjoy perfect wealth and discover immeasurable treasures of merit, and they will directly realize the nature of the Thus-Gone One.

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba nyams shing nyon mongs pas 'khrul ba'i sems can rnams yongs su thar par 'gyur ba'i slad du bstan par gsol /

translated: I respectfully pay homage to the Tathāgata Sarvadharmasamuccayadhārin.🔽I respectfully pay homage to the one who transcends all measure and calculation.

original: zla dang dpe med @511b pa la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: zla dang dpe med @511b pa la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I respectfully pay homage to the one without equal or example.

original: chos mu med pa la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //

original: khams gsum na btsun pa la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khams gsum na btsun pa la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //

translated: upholds the precepts, does not engage in frivolous play or distraction, does not enter into crowds, always cultivates loving-kindness, and regards meditative concentration as supreme,

analyzed: bskal ba dpag tu med pa mchis pa nas gsog gsog pa'i sgrib pa gsum dang / sdig lci ba la sogs pa'ang gzungs sngags 'di thos te sems thag pa nas zlos shing 'dzin pa dang / nyin gcig bzhin klog cing kha ton bgyid pa dang /
translated: then even if they have accumulated the three obscurations and heavy negative karma for immeasurable eons, if they hear this dhāraṇī, recite it from the depths of their mind, uphold it, read it and recite it daily,

original: yi dam du mi brjed par bgyid na /
analyzed: yi dam du mi brjed par bgyid na /
translated: and do not forget their commitment,

original: gang zag de mngon par byang chub ba'i bar du ngan song du mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: gang zag de mngon par byang chub ba'i bar du ngan song du mi ltung ngo //
translated: then until they attain manifest enlightenment, they will not fall into the lower realms.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sengge'i sgra la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sengge'i sgra la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the World-Honored One said to the bodhisattva Siṃhamati, “Excellent, excellent!

original: khyod dkon mchog gsum skyob pa dang / skye bo mang po la phan par sems shing /
analyzed: khyod dkon mchog gsum skyob pa dang / skye bo mang po la phan par sems shing /
translated: You have thought of the Three Treasures as a refuge and of the benefit of many people.

original: srid pa gsum las bsgral zhing gdon pa dang / slob pa grangs med pa la phan pa chen po byed pa dang log par lta ba thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir gzungs sngags phye zhing bstan pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: srid pa gsum las bsgral zhing gdon pa dang / slob pa grangs med pa la phan pa chen po byed pa dang log par lta ba thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir gzungs sngags phye zhing bstan pa legs so legs so //
translated: You have freed them from the three realms of existence, and you have done great good for countless disciples. You have turned them away from all wrong views. It is good that you have explained and taught this dhāraṇī spell.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son!

original: khyod kyi ming dang / gzungs sngags kyi sgra 'di sems can la las thos nas mos pa dag gus pa bskyed de ma skur ba'i mi de ni /
analyzed: khyod kyi ming dang / gzungs sngags kyi sgra 'di sems can la las thos nas mos pa dag gus pa bskyed de ma skur ba'i mi de ni /
translated: If any living being hears this spell of your name and gives rise to faith and respect, that person will not be deceived.

original: tshe 'di la'ang bde ba nas shi 'phos nas kyang rtag tu sangs rgyas mthong zhing nga'ang mthong la /
analyzed: tshe 'di la'ang bde ba nas shi 'phos nas kyang rtag tu sangs rgyas mthong zhing nga'ang mthong la /
translated: In this life he will be happy, and after death he will always see the Buddha and me.

original: khyod dang byang @535b chub sems dpa' gzhan yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod dang byang @535b chub sems dpa' gzhan yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also see you and other bodhisattvas.”

original: de thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po so sor rang gis rig pa mngon par 'tshang rgya ba the tshom mi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po so sor rang gis rig pa mngon par 'tshang rgya ba the tshom mi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All of them will have no doubt that they will attain the realization of the Tathāgata’s essence, which is to be realized by oneself.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs shing dge ba thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs shing dge ba thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam sgrub pa ni /
translated: Abandoning all afflictions and practicing the path of the Tathāgata through all virtues

original: kun kyang mos pa dang / dad pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: kun kyang mos pa dang / dad pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: is due to the power of faith and aspiration.

original: nga 'das pa'i phyi na rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis nyin gcig gam /
analyzed: nga 'das pa'i phyi na rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis nyin gcig gam /
translated: “After my passing, if any son or daughter of good family is able to pay homage to the buddhas of the three times in the ten directions, to the twelve divisions of the scriptures, and to the bodhisattvas in a single day,

original: mtshan gcig gam /
analyzed: mtshan gcig gam /
translated: a single night,

original: dus gcig gam /🔽skad cig la phyogs bcu na dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / gsung rab mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal nus shing /
analyzed: dus gcig gam / skad cig la phyogs bcu na dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / gsung rab mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal nus shing /
translated: a single moment,🔽and to properly contemplate the Mahāyāna, and to contemplate ultimate truth as it is,

original: theg pa chen po tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa ji bzhin bar yid la byed pa'i gang zag de ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa ji bzhin bar yid la byed pa'i gang zag de ni /
translated: that person

original: thang gcig yud tsam gcig gis mi dge ba bcu dang / mtshams med pa lnga dang / mnyam pa nyid la skur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i las thams cad kun ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thang gcig yud tsam gcig gis mi dge ba bcu dang / mtshams med pa lnga dang / mnyam pa nyid la skur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i las thams cad kun ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In a single moment, all the ten nonvirtues, the five heinous acts, the denigration of the equality of all things, and all the actions of the afflictive emotions will be completely purified.

original: yang dge slong pha'am /
analyzed: yang dge slong pha'am /
translated: If a fully ordained monk,

original: dge slong ma'am /🔽byang chub sems dpa' 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma'am / byang chub sems dpa' 'am /
translated: a fully ordained nun,🔽a novice monk,

original: dge tshul pha'am /
analyzed: dge tshul pha'am /
translated: or a novice nun,🔽who has lost the mind of the essence, has destroyed the four roots,🔽has damaged the eight vows,

original: dge tshul mas ngo bo nyid kyi sems stor bas rang gi rtsa ba bzhi gzhig pa dang / sdom pa brgyad nyams pa dang / lci ba drug dang / mi dge ba bcu dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / mnyam pa nyid la skur ba'ang phyogs @536a *//
analyzed: dge tshul mas ngo bo nyid kyi sems stor bas rang gi rtsa ba bzhi gzhig pa dang / sdom pa brgyad nyams pa dang / lci ba drug dang / mi dge ba bcu dang / mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dang / mnyam pa nyid la skur ba'ang phyogs @536a *//
translated: has committed the six grave offenses, the ten nonvirtues, the five heinous acts, and the denigration of the equality of all things,

original: bcu dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan la mos ba bskyed de phyag 'tshal na /
analyzed: bcu dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan la mos ba bskyed de phyag 'tshal na /
translated: and has generated devotion to the names of the bhagavat buddhas who have gone to the ten directions and three times,

original: de lta bu'i las mi dge ba kun ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i las mi dge ba kun ma lus par 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all such nonvirtuous actions will be completely purified.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ma thag tu de nas sangs rgyas 'od nges pa zhes bya ba de'i drug nas de'i tshe rgyal bu dge mthong dang mi sum stong po rnams glo bur du skad cig dus der lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi ba'o stugs
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ma thag tu de nas sangs rgyas 'od nges pa zhes bya ba de'i drug nas de'i tshe rgyal bu dge mthong dang mi sum stong po rnams glo bur du skad cig dus der lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi ba'o stugs
translated: As soon as these words were spoken, the Buddha Light of Certainty suddenly appeared from the six sense bases of the Buddha. At that time, Prince Śubhadra and the three thousand people who had suddenly arrived at that moment bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One.

original: te phyag btsal nas mgrin gcig tu bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: te phyag btsal nas mgrin gcig tu bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having paid homage, they spoke with one voice to the Blessed One, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag cag la sogs pas bskal ba dpag tu ma mchis pa nas mi dge ba bcu'i las bgyis shing bsags pa ni /
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pas bskal ba dpag tu ma mchis pa nas mi dge ba bcu'i las bgyis shing bsags pa ni /
translated: the non-virtuous actions we and others have committed and accumulated for countless eons

original: brjod kyis kyang mi rdzogs te /🔽la las ni /
analyzed: brjod kyis kyang mi rdzogs te / la las ni /
translated: cannot be fully described.

original: mi dge ba bcu bgyis /🔽la las ni /🔽mtshams ma mchis pa lnga bgyis /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu bgyis / la las ni / mtshams ma mchis pa lnga bgyis /
translated: Some have committed the ten non-virtuous actions,🔽some have committed the five heinous acts,

original: la las ni /
analyzed: la las ni /
translated: some have committed the five heinous acts with immediate retribution,🔽and some have committed the five heinous acts with immediate retribution and the ten non-virtuous actions.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi chos la skur ba la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab brjod kyis mi lang ba'i sdig pa bgyis ba de dag dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mdo sde la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' mang po'i mdun du mthol zhing bshegs par 'tshal na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi chos la skur ba la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab brjod kyis mi lang ba'i sdig pa bgyis ba de dag dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mdo sde la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' mang po'i mdun du mthol zhing bshegs par 'tshal na /
translated: I have committed the inconceivable and inexpressible sins of deprecating the Dharma of equality and so forth. I confess them in the presence of many bodhisattvas, relying on the twelve branches of excellent speech of the tathagatas of the three times.

original: de gnang bar gsol lo //
analyzed: de gnang bar gsol lo //
translated: I request that you accept my confession.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the bhagavat said:🔽“It is difficult to generate a fearful mind and a virtuous mind.

original: 'jigs ba'i sems bskyed dka' ba dang / dge ba'i sems bskyed @536b dka' ba las bskyad pa ni /
analyzed: 'jigs ba'i sems bskyed dka' ba dang / dge ba'i sems bskyed @536b dka' ba las bskyad pa ni /
translated: You have generated them.

original: legs pa so legs so //
analyzed: legs pa so legs so //
translated: Excellent! Excellent!

original: khyod kyis mi dge ba bcu bshegs pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga bshags pa dang / 'dod chen la sogs pa bshags nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de mthong bar 'dod pa de legs kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyis mi dge ba bcu bshegs pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga bshags pa dang / 'dod chen la sogs pa bshags nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de mthong bar 'dod pa de legs kyi /
translated: You have confessed the ten nonvirtues, the five heinous acts, and the great desires. You wish to see the tathiagata essence. That is excellent.

original: yid la sems pa bzhin mthol cig /
analyzed: yid la sems pa bzhin mthol cig /
translated: Confess as you contemplate it in your mind.

original: de nas rgyal bu dge mthong dang mi sum stong gis bcom ldan 'das kyi byams pa'i gsung thos nas chos gos tshul bzhin du bgos nas thal mi sbyar te spyi bos btud nas phrag pa g-yas pa chos bzhin du phyung /
analyzed: de nas rgyal bu dge mthong dang mi sum stong gis bcom ldan 'das kyi byams pa'i gsung thos nas chos gos tshul bzhin du bgos nas thal mi sbyar te spyi bos btud nas phrag pa g-yas pa chos bzhin du phyung /
translated: Then Prince Kalyāṇa-darśana and the three thousand people, having heard the Bhagavān’s loving speech, properly adjusted their Dharma robes, joined their palms, bowed their heads, and bared their right shoulders in the Dharma way.

original: bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They placed their right knees on the ground and said to the Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: “We and others pay homage and go for refuge to the Bhagavān Buddhas of the ten directions.

original: phyogs bcu'i chos la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i chos la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: We pay homage and go for refuge to the Dharma of the ten directions.

original: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: We pay homage and go for refuge to the Saṅgha of the ten directions.

original: yang shar phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'khrug mi mnga' la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsal lo //
analyzed: yang shar phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa 'khrug mi mnga' la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsal lo //
translated: We also pay homage and go for refuge to the Tathāgata Akṣobhya in the east.

original: yang lho phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen 'byung ldan la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //🔽yang nub phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa snang ba mtha' yas la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: yang lho phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen 'byung ldan la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo // yang nub phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa snang ba mtha' yas la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Tathāgata Ratnasaṃbhava in the south and go for refuge.🔽I pay homage to the Tathāgata Amitābha in the west and go for refuge.

original: yang byang phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gdon mi za bar grub pa la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //🔽yang steng gi phyogs kyi @537a *//🔽de bzhin gshegs pa spos brtsegs la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: yang byang phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gdon mi za bar grub pa la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo // yang steng gi phyogs kyi @537a *// de bzhin gshegs pa spos brtsegs la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Tathāgata Amoghasiddhi in the north and go for refuge.🔽I pay homage to the Tathāgata Gandhottama in the upper direction and go for refuge.

original: yang 'gog gi phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa 'bum gzugs la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //🔽shar phyogs na 'phags pa kun tu bzang po la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: yang 'gog gi phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa 'bum gzugs la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo // shar phyogs na 'phags pa kun tu bzang po la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Tathāgata Śatakalpa in the lower direction and go for refuge.🔽I pay homage to the noble Samantabhadra in the east and go for refuge.

original: lho phyogs na 'phags pa 'jig rten gzungs la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: lho phyogs na 'phags pa 'jig rten gzungs la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to the noble Lokakṣema in the south and go for refuge.

original: nub phyogs na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: nub phyogs na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and go for refuge to Ārya Avalokiteśvara in the west.

original: byang phyogs na 'phags pa zla rgyas la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: byang phyogs na 'phags pa zla rgyas la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and go for refuge to Ārya Puṇyābha in the north.

original: steng gi phyogs na 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: steng gi phyogs na 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and go for refuge to Ārya Ākāśagarbha above.

original: 'og gi phyogs na 'phags pa yon tan bstan pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: 'og gi phyogs na 'phags pa yon tan bstan pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and go for refuge to Ārya Guṇaprabhāsa below.

original: thog ma'i ston pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od mi 'gyur ba la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo; ;ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: thog ma'i ston pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od mi 'gyur ba la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo; ;ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and go for refuge to the original teacher, the Bhagavān Tathāgata Akṣobhya. I pay homage to and go for refuge to the future Tathāgata Essence.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na sprul ba'i sku sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na sprul ba'i sku sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and go for refuge to the nirmāṇakāya buddhas, the bhagavāns, in other world systems.

original: da ltar bdag cag gi ston pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: da ltar bdag cag gi ston pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I now pay homage to and take refuge in our Teacher, the Blessed One Shakyamuni.

original: bcom ldan 'das dri @537b ma med par grugs pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dri @537b ma med par grugs pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and take refuge in the Blessed One Vimalakirti and the youthful Manjushri.

original: kun dga' bo dang 'od srung la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dang 'od srung la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and take refuge in Ananda and Kashyapa.

original: 'phags pa'i lam bzhis mngon du byung ba rnams la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bzhis mngon du byung ba rnams la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and take refuge in those who have attained realization through the four noble truths.

original: sems bskyed pa dad po pa rnams la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dad po pa rnams la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and take refuge in those who have generated bodhichitta.

original: mdzod chen po gsung rab mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / yang dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi mdo sde la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: mdzod chen po gsung rab mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / yang dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi mdo sde la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and take refuge in the great treasury of the twelve branches of excellent speech and the sutra of suchness.

original: chos kyi mdo sde gzhan ji snyed bzhugs pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi mdo sde gzhan ji snyed bzhugs pa la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to and take refuge in all the other sutras of the Dharma.

original: sku gdung brgyad du bgos pa'i gzugs rnams la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: sku gdung brgyad du bgos pa'i gzugs rnams la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to the relics of the Buddha, and I take refuge in them.

original: da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi don la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
analyzed: da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi don la'ang phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su gsol lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Dharma of the present Buddhas, and I take refuge in it.

original: phyogs bzhi'i rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs ba dang / bar snang gi lha dang / gnam gyi steng dang / sa'i steng dang / sa'i 'og dang / ri'i lha dang /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs ba dang / bar snang gi lha dang / gnam gyi steng dang / sa'i steng dang / sa'i 'og dang / ri'i lha dang /
translated: I pay homage to the four great kings of the four directions, to the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, to Śakra, to Brahmā, to the gods of the space between earth and heaven, to the gods above the earth, to the gods below the earth, to the gods of the mountains,

original: tshal gyi lha dang / shing drug gi lha dang / rigs sngags 'chang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang ldan pa rnams dang / lha'i mig dang ldan pa dang / lha'i rna ba dang ldan pa de dag thams cad kyis gzigs shing gsan te kun gyis dbang mdzad par gsol lo //
analyzed: tshal gyi lha dang / shing drug gi lha dang / rigs sngags 'chang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang ldan pa rnams dang / lha'i mig dang ldan pa dang / lha'i rna ba dang ldan pa de dag thams cad kyis gzigs shing gsan te kun gyis dbang mdzad par gsol lo //
translated: to the gods of the forests, to the gods of the trees, to the gods who uphold the mantras, to the gods who possess the bases of supernatural powers, to the gods who possess the divine eye, and to the gods who possess the divine ear. original: // so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis bskal pa dpag tu ma mchis pa nas sangs rgyas dang / pha ma'i drin glo bar ma chud cing rnam par byang ba'i chos ma 'tshal bas mi dge ba'i las sna tshogs bgyis pa'am /

translated: All ordinary beings, for countless eons, have not understood the kindness of the buddhas and of their parents, and have not known the Dharma of purification. Thus, they have committed various nonvirtuous actions.
